page.title: 05RAZOR SHELLS AT STOVE
page.content: A{local delicacy}is{razorfish,}known locally as{spoots.}They taste lovely, but they have to be caught, which is hard as they{live under the sand. To catch them you need a bucket, a large knife and a{very low tide. To begin with, the bucket is held in one hand and the knife in the other, and you{walk backwards}looking for a {spout of water}or a{little hole}giving away their whereabouts. As soon it's seen, the{knife}is thrust into the sand around the hole and moved in a circular motion, down and inwards, to {trap the shell}in the tunnel of the fleeing creature. Holding the knife still, a hole is then dug with the free hand, to reveal the knife and hopefully the stranded razor-shell. They should be{boiled}out of the shell and are delicious when{coated in {flour}and{fried in butter.
